title: Govt may revive old data centre policy with AI and ML sops
description: The government plans to revisit and revamp its 2020 draft data centre policy, enhancing it with new incentives to better align with the industry's current requirements and expectations. The incentives include granting infrastructure status to the data centres on a par with other sectors such as railways, ports, roads and power.
content: The government is likely to revive the 2020 draft of its data centre policy and spruce it up with improved incentives to meet the current needs and demands of the industry, said people with knowledge of the matter.The incentives include granting infrastructure status to the data centres on a par with other sectors such as railways, ports, roads and power, said one of the persons, who did not wish to be identified.According to another person, the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY)may also grant additional incentives to companies to set up advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) data centres, which require larger and unified setups at the same location.
